query: Ottawa Valley Gravel Experience gravel race Calabogie

videos.title: Gravel Cup Canada: Ottawa Valley Gravel Experience
videos.description:
The first event of the Gravel Cup Canada 2024 season was the Ottawa Valley Gravel Experience, taking place in Calabogie, Ontario. With TONS of laughs, beautiful trails, and all around good vibes, the Kunstadt team had an absolute blast on this ride. Big thanks to Giro, Smith Optics, Trips for Kids Ottawa, and of course - all the organizers of Gravel Cup Canada. See you at the next event!

Visit gravelcup.com for more info!
(Link in bio)

#cycling #gravelcycling #gravelbike #gravelcup #ottawa #Calabogie #bikeshop

videos.title: Ottawa Valley Gravel Experience
videos.description:
Gravel Cup presents the Ottawa Valley Gravel Experience, a gravel cycling event in the Ottawa Valley. More details and registration at GravelCup.com

Date: Saturday Aug 6th 

Gravel event starting from picturesque Calabogie using a spectacular network of single lane maintained old logging roads, a few unmaintained sections including a lane through a farm field. The final section uses the K&P Trail and Grant Rd before arriving back in Calabogie finishing on the K&P Trail 

Start Location: Calabogie Community Hall, 574 Mill St, Calabogie

videos.title: Our Pick-Axe Loop Experience - Part 4 (final)
videos.description:
Sept 20, 2024 - Its fall and as promised we're back with the conclusion of our pick-axe trip. In the final part 4 we travel some nice back roads from Calabogie to Wilno. Stop at Ottawa Valley Feed to Farm to collect or badge. And end it at a familiar stop in Barrys Bay - The Ashgrove Inn. Oh and evidently Duncan has Tourette's.

Ride the Highlands Pick Axe Loop
https://ridethehighlands.ca/en/routes/pick-axe-loop/65

KLR 650C
BMW 850 GSA
DR 650
KTM 890 R Adventure

0:00 - Last time
1:19 - Duncan on the coms!
2:10 - Murray almost buys the farm
2:32 - KP Trail crossing
2:45 - Bad British Accents
3:59 - The Rooter Crows
4:38 - Slippery when dry
5:22 - Ottawa Valley Feed to Farm
6:25 - Eganville map change
7:19 - Hang Loose
7:52 - Start of Foymont Loop
8:51 - But the view!
10:07 - Stay off the grass
11:30 - Jay Whack Construction
11:53 - Ye Olde Killaloe
12:00 - Identity Crisis Road
12:49 - Wilno Hill
13:37 - Wrap up
14:26 - Sled season reference
14:49 - We've been here before
15:23 - Encore: The journey home

videos.title: 175. Gravel Cup CANADA: 2022 Cycling Event Series
videos.description:
PODCAST: https://podcasts.bcast.fm/e/x8v5pm5n
In this episode, you will learn about: How this stay-at-home dad and his passion for cycling prompted him to create a local Gravel Race series around his backyard in the rural Ottawa, On Area. Meet Brendan Gorman

Click here for more episodes: https://podcasts.bcast.fm/secrets-from-the-saddle-all-things-cycling-podcast


Brendan Gorman
Event Director
Gravel Cup Canada
https://gravelcup.com/
https://twitter.com/GravelCup
https://www.instagram.com/gravelcupcan/
https://www.facebook.com/GravelCup

Based in the Gravel Cycling Mecca that is Canada’s National Capital Region, 

Brendan Gorman created Gravel Cup to share his passion for gravel riding, and to provide a platform for gravel cycling enthusiasts to explore new routes, and challenge themselves on a variety of gravel genres. He’s spent countless hours literally lost in the woods, curating the best gravel routes that Ottawa and it’s surrounding counties have to offer. Pick a Gravel Cup route and ride it on your own terms, or better yet, join us for a Gravel Cup event and share the journey with fellow Gravel Grinders.

2022 Current Details
on the @ontariocycling preliminary calendar for Apr 9, May 28, Aug 6 & Sept 10. Two events from Calabogie & two events in the western rural end of Ottawa. One event will use a high proportion of the @ottawavalleytrail & @kptrail along with a couple of others. There won’t be any extreme gnarl but the courses will still be fun, scenic & challenging.

Don't FORGET to Follow the HOST Sylvie D'Aoust at
https://www.instagram.com/sylviedaoust_cyclist/
https://www.instagram.com/secretsfromthesaddlepodcast/
https://www.facebook.com/Daousttrainingsystems
http://www.sylviedaoust.ca

videos.title: Ride the Highlands - A Motorcyclist's Perspective
videos.description:
Follow esteemed motorcycle journalist Dustin Woods and film director Jullian Francis Adderley as they seek to find out why riders are flocking to Ontario, Canada's newest motorcycle playground Ride the Highlands. They have heard the rumours about the twisties and turnies, and beautiful natural scenery, and had to experience it for themselves.

www.ridethehighlands.ca
videos.transcript:
[Music]
We've spent the last couple days riding
through the Highlands region and the
roads are absolutely incredible. There's
obviously a rich history and there's a
lot to see here. Why would you uh
recommend that people come here and
visit this area?
There's probably three reasons. There is
the actual natural scenery we have here.
It's the roads that match a motorcycle's

be perfect. You'll see everything you

they did back in the settlement days
with modern amenities.

that we are still living the way they

now.
